meanings.definition: A distortion of memory in which fact and fantasy are confused.
meanings.sent1: Her paramnesia caused her to mix up what really happened with what she imagined.
meanings.sent2: The patient's paramnesia made it challenging for them to recall actual events.
meanings.sent3: Despite his paramnesia, he still had a vivid recollection of his childhood adventures.
meanings.sent4: The paramnesia in her mind created a blurred line between reality and fiction.
meanings.sent5: The paramnesia in the story made it hard to distinguish between truth and illusion.

meanings.definition: A condition in which a person confuses dreams with reality.
meanings.sent1: His paramnesia led him to believe that his dream was an actual event.
meanings.sent2: Living with paramnesia can be disorienting as dreams feel just as real as waking moments.
meanings.sent3: The paramnesia caused quite a stir when he started recounting his dream as a real experience.
meanings.sent4: In her paramnesia, dreams and reality intertwined like a complex puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The paramnesia made it seem like the dream world and the real world were one and the same.

meanings.definition: A type of memory disorder characterized by the inability to distinguish between real and imagined events.
meanings.sent1: The paramnesia affected his ability to differentiate between actual events and his imagination.
meanings.sent2: People with paramnesia may struggle to separate what truly happened from what they dreamed.
meanings.sent3: Despite his paramnesia, he still managed to lead a fulfilling life.
meanings.sent4: The paramnesia clouded his memories, blending reality and fantasy into one.
meanings.sent5: Her paramnesia made every memory feel like a dream, and every dream feel like a memory.
